articles.author: Luc Cohen, Chris Prentice
articles.description: The U.S. Treasury Department will soon propose a rule that would effectively end anonymous luxury-home purchases, closing a loophole that the agency says allows corrupt oligarchs, terrorists and other criminals to hide ill-gotten gains.
articles.title: US set to unveil long-awaited crackdown on real estate money laundering

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Michael Kors owner Capri (CPRI.N) will be bought by Coach parent Tapestry (TPR.N) in an $8.5 billion deal, the companies said on Thursday, creating a top U.S. fashion house that can better compete with larger European rivals in the global luxury market.
articles.title: Coach parent Tapestry to buy Michael Kors owner in $8.5 bln deal

articles.author: Francesco Canepa
articles.description: The European Central Bank is on the back foot again and this time the bad news doesn't come from Greece, Italy or any of the usual suspects in the bloc's poorer south.
articles.title: Analysis: ECB is on back foot and for once it's down to Germany

articles.author: Sophie Yu, Yew Lun Tian
articles.description: At Nanchengxiang restaurants in Beijing, customers treat themselves to a breakfast buffet with three types of rice porridge, sour and spicy soup, and milk - all for the price of 3 yuan ($0.40).
articles.title: Breakfast for 40 cents: what China's deflation looks like

articles.author: Saqib Ahmed, Nupur Anand
articles.description: The slide in U.S. bank stocks this week appeared to catch traders in the options market by surprise, data shows, raising questions over whether bank investors have become a little too comfortable with the sector that only months ago was in crisis.
articles.title: Analysis: Moody's warning on US banks a wake-up call for sanguine investors

articles.author: James Davey, Muvija M
articles.description: British discount retailer Wilko said it has fallen into administration on Thursday, a form of creditor protection that puts its 12,000 jobs in danger.
articles.title: UK retailer Wilko collapses, putting 12,000 jobs at risk

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's Alibaba Group Holding (9988.HK), reported first-quarter revenue on Thursday that beat analysts' estimates as consumer sentiment bounced back from the same time a year earlier when there were strict pandemic-related lockdowns.
articles.title: Alibaba beats quarterly revenue estimates

articles.author: Special Reports
articles.description: Self-professed messiah Sun Myung Moon bought land in Paraguay 25 years ago, hoping to create an oasis for followers. Now it's hub for global drug trafficking.
articles.title: Cocaine cartels encroach on Unification Church’s Paraguayan paradise

articles.author: Marco Garcia
articles.description: At least 36 people have died after wildfires, fanned by winds from a faraway hurricane, devastated much of the resort city Lahaina on Hawaii's Maui island, the Maui County said in a statement late on Wednesday.
articles.title: Hawaii wildfires kill 36 as 'apocalypse' hits resort city

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's navy said a new temporary Black Sea "humanitarian corridor" had started working on Thursday and that the first ships were expected to use it within days.
articles.title: Ukraine's navy announces Black Sea humanitarian corridor but says Russian threat remains
